class vizasm.analysis.asm.cpu.x86_64.ASM_x86_64.ASM_x86_64(cpu, parse_util)[source]¶

Bases: vizasm.analysis.asm.cpu.AssignmentMatchingSystem.AssignmentMatchingSystem

AssignmentMatchingSystem for the x86_64 architecture.

If a stack fetch is read, the _stack_address will not be set. However the object will be fetched from stack and stored in lobject.

Methods

add_reg_arg_since_last_call(reg, robject) Add a Register to reg_usage_since_last_call if the
clear_usage_since_last_call() The Cpu uses this after a new call has been read

get_stack_push_objects() If is_stack_push, the stored object is a single register -> wrap into list.
get_usage_since_last_call() Get the registers and stack usage since the last call.
number_of_arguments_since_last_call() Get the number of arguments that have been seen since the last call.
process_stack_push() Push the objects onto the stack
read_assignment(asmline) Read an assigment and try to split it.
reset() Use to reset the system after an assignment has been read.

class vizasm.analysis.asm.cpu.x86_64.AsmRegEx_x86_64.AsmRegEx_x86_64[source]¶

Bases: vizasm.analysis.asm.cpu.AsmRegEx.AsmRegEx

Contains regular expressions (mostly in verbose mode) used for analyzing the assembler file on the x86_64 architecture

Parameters :

RE_STACKVAR :

match e.g. “[ss:rbp-0x30+var_40]” or “qword [ss:rbp-0x0+var_m8]”

RE_VAR_ASSIGNMENT :

match e.g. “[ds:rdx+rsi]”

RE_IVAR :

match e.g. “[ds:_OBJC_IVAR_$_AppDelegate.obj3]”

RE_CLASSREF :

match e.g. “[ds:objc_classref_Object1]”

RE_FRAMEWORKCLASS :

match e.g. “[ds:bind__OBJC_CLASS_$_NSUserDefaults]”

__RE_IMP :

Used for RE_IMP_STUBS and RE_IMP_GOT. DO NOT USE DIRECTLY !

RE_IMP_STUBS :

match e.g “imp___stubs__NSApplicationMain”, “imp___stubs__objc_retain”, “imp___stubs__objc_msgSend” ...

RE_IMP_GOT :

match e.g “imp___got__NSStreamSocketSecurityLevelKey”, “imp___got___NSConcreteStackBlock”, “imp___got____gxx_personality_v0”

RE_ASSINGMENT_SPLIT :

match e.g. “mov rax, qword [ss:rbp-0x70+var_88]” or

“lea rax, qword [ds:objc_msg_alloc] ; @selector(alloc)” or “cvtss2sd xmm2, xmm2”

RE_CALL_INSTRUCTION :

match e.g. “call imp___stubs__objc_msgSend” or “jmp qword [ds:imp___got__objc_msgSend]”

RE_REGISTER :

match e.g. “ds:[rdi]”, “rdi”, “qword [ds:rdi]”

RE_ADD_METHOD_ARG_STACK :

match e.g. “arg_0”

Methods

compiled_re(regex[, flags]) Returns a compiled regex pattern object
compiled_re_stack(stack_pointer_name) Return a compiled regular expression that matches e.g.
compiled_vre(regex[, flags]) Returns a compiled regex pattern object
is_entrypoint(asmline) Check if line is entry point in asm file (See AsmRegEx.RE_MATCH_ENTRYPOINT)
is_method_implementation(asmline) Indicates if a line is a CategoryClass or method implementation.
method_implementation_is_static(...) Returns if the method is static
RE_ADD_METHOD_ARG_STACK = '\n arg[_]\n (?P<arg_nr>\\w+)\n '¶
RE_ADD_METHOD_ARG_STACK_GR_ARG_NR = 'arg_nr'¶
RE_ASSINGMENT_SPLIT = '\n (mov[a-z]*|lea|cvt.*)\\s+ # mov\n (?P<val1>.*?) # rax\n ,\\s* # ,\n (?P<val2>.*) # qword [ss:rbp-0x70+var_88]\n '¶
RE_ASSINGMENT_SPLIT_GR_VAL1 = 'val1'¶
RE_ASSINGMENT_SPLIT_GR_VAL2 = 'val2'¶
RE_CALL_INSTRUCTION = '\n (call|jmp)\\s+ # call \n (?P<called>.*) # imp___stubs__objc_msgSend\n'¶
RE_CALL_INSTRUCTION_GR_CALLED = 'called'¶
RE_CLASSREF = '\n \\[ds\\: # [ds:\n objc[_]classref[_] # objc_classref_\n (?P<classref>\\w+) # Object1\n \\] # ]\n'¶
RE_CLASSREF_GR_CLASSREF = 'classref'¶
RE_FRAMEWORKCLASS = '\n \\[ds\\: # [ds:\n bind[_]{2}OBJC[_]CLASS[_]\\$[_] # bind__OBJC_CLASS_$_\n (?P<frameworkclass>\\w+) # NSUserDefaults\n \\] # ]\n'¶
RE_FRAMEWORKCLASS_GR_FCLASS = 'frameworkclass'¶
RE_IMP_GOT = '\n (\\[(ds|ss)[:])? # [ds: <- optional \n (?:imp[_]{3}got[_]{2,}) # imp___stubs__ or imp___got__ <- this seems to be the 64 bit version\n (?P<imp_got>\\w+) # NSLog\n (\\])? # ] <- optional\n '¶
RE_IMP_GOT_GR_IMP_GOT = 'imp_got'¶
RE_IMP_STUBS = '\n (\\[(ds|ss)[:])? # [ds: <- optional \n (?:imp[_]{3}stubs[_]{2,}) # imp___stubs__ or imp___got__ <- this seems to be the 64 bit version\n (?P<imp_stubs>\\w+) # NSLog\n (\\])? # ] <- optional\n '¶
RE_IMP_STUBS_GR_IMP_STUBS = 'imp_stubs'¶
RE_IVAR = '\n \\[ds\\: # [ds:\n [_]OBJC[_]IVAR[_]\\$[_] # _OBJC_IVAR_$_\n (?P<class>\\w+) # AppDelegate\n \\. # .\n (?P<ivar>\\w+) # obj3\n \\] # ]\n'¶
RE_IVAR_GR_CLASS = 'class'¶
RE_IVAR_GR_IVAR = 'ivar'¶
RE_REGISTER = '\n(?:^(ds|ss)[:]\\[)(?P<ds_reg>[a-z]+[a-z0-9A-Z]{,3})(?:\\]$) # ds:[rdi] or\n|\n(?P<reg>^[a-z]+[a-z0-9A-Z]{,3}$) # rdi or\n|\n(?:(byte|word)\\ \\[(ds|ss)[:])(?P<qword_reg>[a-z]+[a-z0-9A-Z]{,3})(?:\\]) # qword [ds:rdi]\n'¶
RE_REGISTER_DS_REG = '[a-z]+[a-z0-9A-Z]{,3}'¶
RE_REGISTER_GR_DS_REG = 'ds_reg'¶
RE_REGISTER_GR_QWORD_REG = 'qword_reg'¶
RE_REGISTER_GR_REG = 'reg'¶
RE_REGISTER_REG = '^[a-z]+[a-z0-9A-Z]{,3}$'¶
RE_STACKVAR = '\n \\[ss\\: # [ss:\n [\\w\\-]+\\+ # rbp-0x30+ \n (?P<stackvar>\\w+) # var_40\n '¶
RE_STACKVAR_GR_STACKVAR = 'stackvar'¶
RE_STACK_GR_ADDRESS = 'stack_adress'¶
RE_STACK_GR_REG = 'stack_register'¶
RE_VAR_ASSIGNMENT = '\n \\[ds\\: # [ds:\n (?P<class>\\w+) # rdx\n \\+ # +\n (?P<var>\\w+) # rsi\n (\\+0x0)? # + 0x0\n \\] # ]\n'¶
RE_VAR_ASSIGNMENT_GR_IVAR_REG = 'var'¶
RE_VAR_ASSIGNMENT_GR_SELF_REGISTER = 'class'¶
static compiled_re_stack(stack_pointer_name)[source]¶

Return a compiled regular expression that matches e.g. “qword [ss:rsp+0x8]” Use RE_STACK_GR_ADDRESS group key to get the stack address.

Parameters :

stack_pointer_name: string :

the name of stack pointer register (e.g. “rsp”)

create_and_store_method_selector_arguments(method_selector)[source]¶

Create and store the arguments for the method_selector. There will be as many arguments created as the Selector needs. But at most as many as the selector_arg_registers specifies. This also specifies the registers in which the arguments will be stored.

The other ones have to be taken from the stack!

Parameters :

method_selector: Selector :

the Selector describing the method that is currently being read by the Cpu
Raises :

SelectorOverloadedException :

if selector has more arguments than it needs
create_and_store_remaining_method_selector_arguments(start_addr, method_selector)[source]¶

Create and store the remaining arguments for the method_selector. There will be as many arguments created as the Selector still needs and stored as StackVar.

Parameters :

start_addr: int :

the suffix for the first StackVar argument (e.g. arg_4)

method_selector: Selector :

the Selector describing the method that is currently being read by the Cpu
Raises :

SelectorOverloadedException :

if selector has more arguments than it needs

static parse_additional_method_argument_stack(asmline)[source]¶

Parse an additional argument that lies on the stack. Prefix is “arg_”. Returns the prefix of the argument (value after “_”) as string

register: string :
Returns :

register: `register_type` :

the register wrapped in register_type

None :

if regular expression did not classify as register
parse_stack_access(asmline)[source]¶

Parse a stack access like e.g. “[ss:rsp+0x8]” or “[ss:rsp]”. The latter leads to an address of 0x0.

Returns :

tuple<string, string> :

Return the stack pointer name as well as the stack address as hex string.
parse_stackvar(asmline)[source]¶

Create an StackVar from asmline, match e.g. [ss:rbp-0x30+var_40]

parse_var_assignment_with_ivar_ref_from_asmline(asmline)[source]¶

Create a VarAssignment from asmline like e.g. “[ds:rdx+rsi], rax”. Try to resolve the ivar_ref of the IVar from the register of the right side of the assignment.

Parameters :

asmline: String :

the asmline should have the form of “[ds:rdx+rsi], rax” where the part after the comma is optional. If left out, the ivar_ref cannot be resolved.

cpu: Cpu :

the cpu which is needed for resolving the values of the registers
Returns :

VarAssignment :

the VarAssignment with ivar_ref set (None if no VarAssignment)
Raises :

VarAssignmentResolveSelfrefRegisterException :

if the value cannot be resolved

VarAssignmentResolveIvarRegisterException :

if the value cannot be resolved and resolve_ivar_value is true

VarAssignmentIvarRegisterWrongTypeException :

if the type of the ivar_reg is not IVar and `resolve_ivar_value is true
parse_var_assignment_without_ivar_ref_from_asmline(asmline)[source]¶

Create a VarAssignment from asmline like e.g. “[ds:rax+rcx]”

Parameters :

asmline: String :
Returns :

VarAssignment :

the VarAssignment without ivar_ref set (None if no VarAssignment)
Raises :

VarAssignmentResolveSelfrefRegisterException :

if the value cannot be resolved

VarAssignmentResolveIvarRegisterException :

if the value cannot be resolved and resolve_ivar_value is true

VarAssignmentIvarRegisterWrongTypeException :

if the type of the ivar_reg is not IVar and `resolve_ivar_value is true
